sen.j: 中村魁春（なかむらかいしゅん）は歌舞伎の名跡の一。
sen.e: Kaishun NAKAMURA is a professional name for a kabuki actor.
Kaishun NAKAMURA is a Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors) actor's professional name.
Kaishun NAKAMURA is a Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors) actor's professional name.

sen.j: 六代目中村歌右衛門の俳名を次男の中村松江が襲名したことに端を発する。
sen.e: Originally, it was the Haimyo (a.k.a. Haimei) (a pen name as a haiku poet, as well as a kabuki actor's offstage name which can be used officially and privately) of Utaemon NAKAMURA the sixth, succeeded by his second son, Matsue NAKAMURA.

It originated that the haimyo (also known as haimei, a kabuki actor's offstage name which can be used officially and privately) of the sixth Utaemon NAKAMURA was succeeded by his second son, Matsue NAKAMURA.

It originated that the haimyo (also known as haimei, a kabuki actor's offstage name which can be used officially and privately) of the sixth Utaemon NAKAMURA was succeeded by his second son, Matsue NAKAMURA.
His stage family name is Kagaya (Kabuki).
The stage family name was Kagaya.
sen.cmt: 原文には「（歌舞伎）」 とありますが、リンク先の単語が抽出されるバグのようですので、訳出しておりません。
sen.e: The stage family name was Kagaya.
His jomon (family crest) is Ume Yatsu-fuji.
The Jomon (family crest) was Ume Yatsufuji (literally, plum and eight wisteria blossoms).
The Jomon (family crest) was Ume Yatsufuji (literally, plum and eight wisteria blossoms).

sen.j: 魁春という俳名を命名したのは徳富蘇峰。
sen.e: It was Soho TOKUTOMI who named the Haimyo of Kaisyun.
It was Soho TOKUTOMI who named the haimyo of Kaishun.
It was Soho TOKUTOMI who named the haimyo of Kaishun.

sen.j: 成駒屋のウメの紋にちなんでつけられた。
sen.e: The name was associated with the Narikomaya's crest of Japanese plum.
The name was associated with the Narikomaya's crest of Ume (Japanese plum).
The name was associated with the Narikomaya's crest of Ume (Japanese plum).

sen.j: 初代中村魁春 六代目中村歌右衛門 (6代目)の俳名。
sen.e: Kaishun NAKAMURA, the first, was the haimyo of Utaemon NAKAMURA the sixth.
The first Kaishun NAKAMURA: The haimyo of Utaemon NAKAMURA (the sixth).
The first Kaishun NAKAMURA: The haimyo of Utaemon NAKAMURA (the sixth).

sen.j: 二代目中村魁春（1948年（昭和23年）1月1日 -） 初代の養子。
sen.e: Kaishun NAKAMURA, the second (January 1, 1948 -), was an adopted son of the first.
sen.cmt: 前列に「次男」とあるので、養子が複数の可能性もあるとして訳しました。
sen.e: The second Kaishun NAKAMURA (January 1, 1948 -) is an adopted son of the first.
The second Kaishun NAKAMURA (January 1, 1948 -) is an adopted son of the first.

sen.j: 先名は加賀屋橋之助および1967年（昭和42年）より五代目中村松江。
sen.e: He had formerly been called Hashinosuke KAGAYA and then Matsue NAKAMURA, the fifth, since 1967.
He formerly called himself Hashinosuke KAGAYA, then the fifth Matsue NAKAMURA since 1967.
He formerly called himself Hashinosuke KAGAYA, then the fifth Matsue NAKAMURA since 1967.

sen.j: 2002年（平成14年）4月に魁春襲名、2008年（平成20年）紫綬褒章受章。
sen.e: In April, 2002, he succeeded the name of Kaisyun, and then in 2008 he received Shiju-hosho (Medal of Honor with the Purple Ribbon).
In April, 2002, he succeeded the name of Kaishun, and then in 2008 he received Shiju-hosho (Medal of Honor with the Purple Ribbon).
In April, 2002, he succeeded the name of Kaishun, and then in 2008 he received Shiju-hosho (Medal of Honor with the Purple Ribbon).

sen.j: 中村魁春 (2代目)の項参照。
sen.e: See the item of Kaisyun Nakamura, the second.
See the article of Kaishun NAKAMURA (the second).
See the article of Kaishun NAKAMURA (the second).
